Posts.Content: Hi  I had a similar dilemma that knawed away , in April this year . Not only did I feel immense guilt at turning my children's life upside down but also my daughter aged 16 was revising for GCSEs and my son was finishing his final exams / dissertation for his degree. So I waited about 2 weeks for initial biopsy results date for op , and treatment plan of chemo . It was hell during those 2 weeks but my husband and I sat them down , when we knew son would be home and told them - they asked questions and having waited I had most of the answers which reassured them . We cried , hugged and when they said they felt useless I said no - revise , complete exams and kick cancers butt as I too had final exam for my degre ( that way actions are saying  cancer you are not winning !! It's not easy , but the relief was immense , we talk openly  about it as I didn't want it being an awkward elephant in the room , yes we've had outbursts and melt downs initially  but it makes me proud  how resilient , and strong they were .  You will find the time  and how best to tell them  Sharon X

Posts.Content: Hi clairelouB  Although I'm due to start chemo I can fully relate to where you are now - I had a pain and swelling  in left armpit  which  I put down to doing loads of decorating, went to GP , and referral made ..., biopsies later and ultrasound etc and was told I had a large tumour that was cancerous and cancerous axillary nodes - requiring a mastectomy , I was devastated , angry , shocked and my mind went into overdrive , when I told friends and family reactions ranged from tears of " I'm so sorry" to " don't worry a mastectomy will get rid of it " - solutions to a diagnosis that seemed to be my new  identity , that absorbed my thinking and actions . No one seemed to acknowledge the old me , post diagnosis , yes I wanted to run , deny needed a mastectomy and hating the cancer that was changing every aspect of me .  Then post mastectomy I was told my tumour was 8.5cm and 27 out of 29 lymph nodes were cancerous so friends reactions changed to me being lucky it was caught !! Lucky I thought !! It's changed my life and I'm lucky so again emotions spiralled from anger, fear and feeling stupid , self judgemental as to how I could not have noticed which was hard to get my head round  So I got a diary - and wrote it all down , spilled my anger , rage , anxiety out ..when I felt I needed to , my diary , a bit of me  that cancer couldn't control , and became a work book also to plan and prepare for each stage I may read it when I finish chemo , radiotherapy but I may burn it - my choice my control bit  Sorry for long winded blog - what I'm trying to say is use this forum - ( people are so reassuring , supportive and give wonderful advice "listening " to questions and anxieties .At the moment you will be overwhelmed with diverse emotions , don't isolate yourself , you will gain strength  you just need to find it and going through these emotions is a process , a means to find strategies and manage them - above all you on not alone  Best wishes  Sharon xxxx
Posts.Title: Coping With the Waiting !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi  No you are not being silly at all , I received great invaluable advice and tips from ladies in this group from ladies in this group before I started  my chemo. I started a chemo box - my way of feeling incontrol , which contained: -Baby soft toothbrushes ( changed every 3 weeks/ new chemo cycle)  - mints / soft or chewy - skin moisturiser that I applied daily  - thermometer - diary ,to record daily temp , side effects,tabs taken - as sometimes patterns appear during chemo cycles  - bamboo caps , great for keeping scalp warm or cool and soft  - a journal ( personal choice ,to record experiences, feelings etc during my treatment journey which i find quite cathartic , I may keep or burn after wards- again my choice )  - evonail - recommended by a lady from this group , so far no problems and I'm due to have final chemo this week  - hand / foot cream , applied twice daily  - jel pad pillow insert , for hot flushes brought on from chemo ( also used cool spray when it was hot)  -  lip balm  Most important : listen to your body , rest when it tells you and drink loads  Good luck with your treatment , I found prep helped me a lot  Xxxx
